items.sentence: I hope that Tom isn't the only one who plans to be there.
I saw a lot of dirty clothes in the corner of Tom's room.
What do you think the most popular sport in the world is?
Tom promised his parents that he'd never drink and drive.
As long as basic needs are met, there's no need to worry.
Why didn't you do that yesterday like you said you would?
How much money do you think it cost to build that museum?
Have you made up your mind whether you'll do that or not?
Tom fell asleep almost as soon as he sat in the armchair.
You're about the same age as your girlfriend, aren't you?
You're almost young enough to be my daughter, aren't you?
You're supposed to be home with your parents, aren't you?
You're the only one who didn't pass the test, aren't you?
You're the only one who knows how to do that, aren't you?
You're the only one who knows how to do this, aren't you?
I only bought about half the things that I needed to buy.
I know some French, but not enough to apply for that job.
Tom carries a flask of tequila with him wherever he goes.
If you ever need anyone to talk to, feel free to call me.
I know that it's highly unlikely that anyone can help me.
